title: The Best Latin Songs and Albums of 2023
description: Releases from artists like Karol G, Bad Bunny, Omar Apollo, Tokischa and many more made it another exciting year in Latin music

title: What to Know About the U.S. Coalition Force in the Red Sea
description: The U.S. has recruited 10 countries to help patrol the Red Sea and prevent cargo ships fro being attacked by Houthi Rebels in Yemen.

title: What Today’s University Presidents Can Learn From the First Modern Expulsion Over Hate Speech on Campus
description: A 1990 case from Brown University was the first time a modern university expelled a student for a violation of a "hate speech code.”

title: What Today’s University Presidents Can Learn From the First Modern Expulsion Over Hate Speech on Campus
description: A 1990 case from Brown University was the first time a modern university expelled a student for a violation of a "hate speech code.”

title: After My Parents Died, I Lost the Christmas Spirit. Now It’s Slowly Coming Back
description: "I think I’ve gotten better at living with joy and grief at once, no longer expecting one to rise up and conquer the other"

title: Einstein’s Complicated Relationship to Judaism
description: Samuel Graydon explores how Einstein became an unwavering proponent of Zionism.

title: TIME Appoints Kelly Conniff as Deputy Editor
description: TIME Editor in Chief Sam Jacobs sent the following note to staff on Tuesday: Dear all, I am delighted to announce that Kelly Conniff has been promoted to Deputy Editor. In this role, Kelly will be my partner in making the day-to-day and strategic decisions for our journalism and lead editorial relationships across the business.…

title: The Surprising Origins of Popular Christmas Songs
description: Many of the songs played throughout December to spark holiday cheer actually have some depressing origin stories

title: Death Sentences Are Doled Out Based on Looks
description: A new study finds a disturbing pattern of jury bias

title: Paywalls Are Slowing the Quest For a Cancer Cure
description: Paywalls to scientific journals are hindering access and slowing progress to cures for cancer.

title: The Fed’s 2% Inflation Target Is a Made Up Number
description: As the U.S. economy sends confusing signals, it's not clear why the Federal Reserve is set on the arbitrary 2% inflation target.

title: Why Gift-Giving Makes You Anxious
description: Scott Rick unpacks the psychology behind why gift-giving occasions stress us out.

title: How—and Why—Yemen’s Houthi Rebels Are Poised to Seriously Disrupt the Global Economy
description: If the Red Sea "blockade" by the Yemeni rebel group continues, the impact on consumers and on local states will be considerable.

title: ‘All-Out‘ Rescue Efforts Underway in Northwest China as Earthquake Leaves Over 100 Dead
description: Chinese authorities worry that high altitude and cold weather will exacerbate the impact of a deadly earthquake in Gansu province.

title: Apple Scrambles to Tweak Its Watches in Face of Looming U.S. Ban
description: Without a last-minute veto by the White House, a ban due to an alleged patent-infringing feature will take effect on Dec. 25.

title: Texas Governor Signs Bill for Police to Arrest Migrants Suspected of Entering U.S. Illegally
description: Opponents have called the measure the most dramatic attempt by a state to police immigration since a 2010 Arizona law that was largely struck down by the U.S. Supreme Court.
